required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Changing to DuoTrav in Patients Uncontrolled on Timolol
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Efficacy of Using the Travoprost/Timolol Fixed Combination (DuoTrav®) in Patients With Open-Angle Glaucoma or Uncontrolled Ocular Hypertension by Beta-blocker Monotherapy (Timolol 0.5%)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to assess the safety and intraocular pressure (IOP)-lowering efficacy of changing to DuoTrav® from prior timolol 0.5% monotherapy in participants with open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Intraocular Pressure (IOP) Change at the Final Visit From Baseline (Prior Beta-blocker Monotherapy)
primary_outcome.description: As measured by Goldmann applanation tonometry. High IOP (outside the normal range) can be a risk factor for developing glaucoma or glaucoma progression (leading to optic nerve damage). A more negative change indicates a greater amount of improvement.

arm_group.description: Travoprost 0.004%/timolol maleate 0.5% fixed combination, one drop to the study eye nightly for up to 6 weeks

facility.name: Contact Alcon Call Center for Trial Locations

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited and enrolled from 4 study centers located in Brazil.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 50 enrolled, 1 participant did not meet inclusion/exclusion criteria and was exited from the study prior to receiving study product. This reporting group includes all participants who received study product.

group.title: DuoTrav
group.description: Travoprost 0.004%/timolol maleate 0.5% fixed combination, one drop to the study eye nightly for up to 6 weeks

baseline.population: This reporting group includes all participants who received study product.

group.title: DuoTrav
group.description: Travoprost 0.004%/timolol maleate 0.5% fixed combination, one drop to the study eye nightly for up to 6 weeks

outcome.title: Mean Intraocular Pressure (IOP) Change at the Final Visit From Baseline (Prior Beta-blocker Monotherapy)
outcome.description: As measured by Goldmann applanation tonometry. High IOP (outside the normal range) can be a risk factor for developing glaucoma or glaucoma progression (leading to optic nerve damage). A more negative change indicates a greater amount of improvement.
outcome.population: Intent-to-Treat (ITT): All participants who received study medication and had at least one on-therapy study visit.

group.description: Travoprost 0.004%/timolol maleate 0.5% fixed combination, one drop to the study eye nightly for up to 6 weeks

measure.description: As measured by Goldmann applanation tonometry. High IOP (outside the normal range) can be a risk factor for developing glaucoma or glaucoma progression (leading to optic nerve damage). A more negative change indicates a greater amount of improvement.
measure.population: Intent-to-Treat (ITT): All participants who received study medication and had at least one on-therapy study visit.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected for the duration of the study.
reported_events.desc: This reporting group includes all participants who received study product.

group.description: Travoprost 0.004%/timolol maleate 0.5% fixed combination, one drop to the study eye nightly for up to 6 weeks

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Doug Hubatsch, Global Brand Medical Affairs Leader, Glaucoma
